result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Schweitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John R Schweitzer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John R Schweitzer was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Pay costs of action and costs of probation. 

Attend, pay for and successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program or Anger Management  program or both at direction of agent.

AODA assessment and follow through, with recommendations of counselor.

Must submit to psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations of counselor.

Submit DNA sample and surcharge. 

Def is to sign up for probation today.
Concurrent with: 15CM107

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Probation Agent Terry Salisbury in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court.  Hearing today is re def's request on d.a. classes; def has asked for modification or Court's permission not to do the classes due to his work schedule.  DA objects to the request; states her rationale.  P/P Agent Salisbury addresses the Court.  Court denies the request; def must continue with the classes.
Hearing was scheduled/JS appeared late. Court directs rescheduling to May 11.
from JS; Response from Judge Sharp noted 05-02-16

Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  At request of counsel, this matter adj. to tomorrow at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Defendant John R. Schweitzer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Status given. Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Conditions of bond amended so as to allow contact with AM for childcare purposes only - no other contact.  All other conditions of the bond remain the same as the original bond.

Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court reads the complaint and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Atty. A - def stands mute for entry of NG pleas.  Counsel request status 9/16.  ADA states that the victim has requested modification of bond; does not object to amendment of contact for the purposes of child care and custody.  ADA states def is presently in jail, subject to revocation of probation.  Court grants the request of the State - conditions of bond amended so as to allow contact with AM for childcare purposes only - no other contact.  All other conditions of the bond remain the same.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
